trustfund:
TF020855-AUSTRIAN CONSULTANT TRUST FUND
            FOR E & C EUROPE,TF032340-ALBANIA - DURRES WATER SUPPLY
            REHABILITATION PROJECT,TF031027-ALBANIA - DURRES WATER SUPPLY
            REHABILITATION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the Durres Water
            and Sanitation Rehabilitation Project is rated as
            unsatisfactory. The significant lessons learned during this
            project include: 1) During the preparation stage, the
            project suffered from a failure to identify key weaknesses
            of the sector and to act decisively to overcome them. 2) It
            was not possible and unrealistic to expect the Government to
            support substantial institutional changes in one water
            enterprise without linking it to broader sector reforms to
            address the fundamental imbalances in the sector. 3)
            Politicization of tariff liberalization, staff recruitment,
            and other administrative and financial matters undermined
            the potential for reform in the water and sewage sector and
            diminished improvements in service delivery. 4) The
            commercial and financial autonomy of the Durres District
            Water Works (DDWW) was essential to reduce political
            interference in the day-to-day management and to achieve the
            financial objectives for DDWW. 5) Local government
            participation in the project preparation and implementation
            was essential to establish ownership and commitment. 6)
            Frequent changes of the Ministers of the Ministry of Public
            Works and of the General Managers of the Water and Sewerage
            Directory had a very negative impact on continuity,
            commitment, and meeting development objectives. 7)
            Implementation of technical assistance for institutional
            improvements at the outset was critical for achieving the
            project objectives.
